TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: I'd like this alternate TKS mid section. You can combine the cargo bays to make one big one, so it makes sense that you should be able to do the same with the crewed containers.

Thanks

And no, unfortunately not as the size adapters are built in.

I am considering releasing an alternate TKS mid-section, which would take up the full length rather than two parts and seat maybe 3-4 Kerbals.

Also there will be some basic adapters between the 1.875m parts and the stock part sizes.

Cool, cool. I just figured you could hit two birds with one stone, you know? But whatever works best for you, of course.

More Salyut Stuff!

The body work is coming together.

Textures are still a bit iffy, I'm gonna redo a few areas.

Still need to do Service Module!

But it looks the part! (I hope, at least)

Hi!

To answer you both, the new omni antenna is mine.

It currently has a whopping 10Mm range, but that should be changed.

I'm looking into fixed panels Hopefully.

@gooddog15, the launch vehicle is infact a SLS engine with infinite fuel and a decoupler. Nothing too fancy

Hey Beale,

I was wondering if you, or someone else, could add a heatshield to the TKS descent module? The problem is when you stick a heatshield underneath it, it has this curved gap that really spoils the looks of the craft:

I really want to use this module for a lot of ships, but this just doesn't look good.

Hey Beale,

I was wondering if you, or someone else, could add a heatshield to the TKS descent module? The problem is when you stick a heatshield underneath it, it has this curved gap that really spoils the looks of the craft:

http://i.imgur.com/wZ47Pzo.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/HoP9YWm.jpg

I really want to use this module for a lot of ships, but this just doesn't look good.

Hi!

The VA is supposed to have a built in one.

But as Kirondoll mentioned, it seems to have been forgotten in the current release. I'll put it up when I can.

If you just add this to your deadly re-entry config, it will work. Heat protection without the extra part.

Hope this helps! 

@PART[Alnair_Crew_A]:NEEDS[DeadlyReentry]
{
@maxTemp = 1700
MODULE
{
name = ModuleHeatShield
direction = 0, -1, 0
reflective = 0.05
ablative = AblativeShielding
loss
{
key = 650 0 0 0 
key = 1000 64 0 0
key = 3000 80 0 0 
}
dissipation
{
key = 300 0 0 0
key = 500 180 0 0
}
}
RESOURCE
{
name = AblativeShielding
amount = 250
maxAmount = 250
}
}

On a side note, I'm sure I saw some stand-alone heat-shields with automatic fairings? Maybe not

Edited August 12, 2014 by Beale
Cool man, thanks! I'll add it in. Do you remember where you saw the stand along automatic fairing heat shields?

Recent RealChutes mod has a MM patch for Tantares chutes.

And it produces a weird bug - chute direction is in the same direction as the motion(when going up - the chute cupola's pointed up, and when going down - the chute cupola's pointed down).

Proly, there's some issue in tantares chute model. For, when I change RealChutes config to this:


	MODULE
	{
		name = ProceduralChute
		textureLibrary = StockReplacement
		currentCanopies = Main chute
	}

instead of this


	MODULE
	{
		name = ProceduralChute
	}

, it works like a charm.

About Vostok... I'm not really interested at the moment. It really was a very basic spacecraft (or as "basic" as manned spacecraft get at least), so there's not really a lot of interesting stuff going on there for me.[/ quote] Test (tantares) Vostok...

Edited August 14, 2014 by kopapaka

Recent RealChutes mod has a MM patch for Tantares chutes.

And it produces a weird bug - chute direction is in the same direction as the motion(when going up - the chute cupola's pointed up, and when going down - the chute cupola's pointed down).

Proly, there's some issue in tantares chute model. For, when I change RealChutes config to this:


	MODULE
	{
		name = ProceduralChute
		textureLibrary = StockReplacement
		currentCanopies = Main chute
	}

instead of this


	MODULE
	{
		name = ProceduralChute
	}

, it works like a charm.

Thanks for bringing this to my attention

It's probably to do with my screwy model orientation on the Tantares' chute model.

I'll see what can be done
